events.name: Powershell - Chef crash course
events.description: Hello Everyone, I would like to invite everyone to join us 9 July for special meetup. We will be hosting Trevor Hess. Trevor will present crash course for Chef. During this meetup we'll be running through the basics of Chef! We'll understand the anatomy of a cookbook and how to write one. As well as talking about some cookbook best practices! We'll touch on using test-kitchen and inspec as well, so that we can be sure our cookbooks are tested! Come learn how to get started using configuration management with Chef! This meetup, we have one request. To be able fully participate in this meetup you are required to bring laptop or device capable of using a Remote Desktop Client to connect to Azure Virtual Machines.  Thank you and see you 9 July Saturday.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Videography Training for Volunteers
events.description:
Free workshop for Engineers.SG volunteers and member of the tech community interested in learning about recording meetups.

Agenda:
- Intro to Engineers.SG
- Basic elements of event recording
- Introduction to our setup
- Hands-on: assemble and teardown
- Post-production tips
- General steps taken after video is uploaded to YouTube

You do not need to prepare anything. All the gear will be made available.

Email miccheng@engineers.sg if you have any questions.

Join our Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1070735369629915/
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576

events.name: Project Accelerator: Halogen, O’Joy and Salvation Army
events.description:
Project Accelerator: Halogen, O’Joy and Salvation Army Our Project Accelerator will bring together experts with data science and analytical backgrounds to help non-profit organizations take the first steps to a successful data science project.   To ensure that our discussions are productive, we have to limit the number of people that can attend this event. Unfortunately, that means that not everyone who wishes to attend will be able to do so. Please do think about the RSVP questions and how you will be able to contribute to the discussions. Sign up if you’re ready to be an active participant! For this event, we will be featuring Halogen, O’Joy and Salvation Army. Agenda   1 pm: Registration (NO food will be provided, so please have your lunch before) 1.15 pm: Introduction  1.20 pm: Overview by Featured Organizations 2 pm: Break-out for group discussions 4.30 pm: Reconvene to share learnings, and see how this can be brought forward Special thanks to ThoughtWorks for being our venue sponsor! How it works Each organization will have its own breakout group of interested volunteers and a facilitator to brainstorm and discuss ideas to help the organization get ready to embark on a data project.  Please take some time to review the one-pagers for each organization before you decide which team you would like to join for the project accelerator. The document gives a brief overview of each organization, the data that they have, and the questions that they would like to work on. Do note that there will NOT be any data or coding during the event. HalogenFounded in 2003, Halogen Foundation Singapore is a values–based, not-for-profit Institution of Public Character (IPC) dedicated to youth leadership and entrepreneurship development. O’JoyEstablished in 2004 by a group of social workers and professional counselors, aim to enhance psycho-social well-being of the older persons, as well as their families. The Salvation ArmyThe Salvation Army has been serving the underprivileged in Singapore, regardless of age, race or religion, since 1935 and has established a comprehensive network of social services. General discussion topics • What is your organization's goal? What does the world look like when you succeed? • What is the biggest problem you're facing? • What does your data look like (specific questions as needed)? • What types of questions can you answer with the data you have? • What problems do you have with your current data? • Where can you find or how can you better collect the data you need? • What do you think you can take away from this discussion, and what will be a good next step? RSVP questions: When you RSVP, please let us know three things: 1)  Your full name (for registration purposes) 2)  Your email addressIf you are confirmed going, we will add you to slack, a communication tool where you can engage with the non-profit organizations before the event to learn more. So please make sure that your email address is correct. 3)  Your preferred organizationPlease let us know which project team you are keen to join, and how you feel you could contribute to this organization. 


We look forward to having you at our Project Accelerator!
